publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-2366# Helen Eadie: Consultation and Advocacy Promotion Serviceâ€”That the Parliament congratulates the Consultation and Advocacy Promotion Service on its 10th anniversary and commends the work of the service in promoting and supporting the collective involvement of mental health service users in Edinburgh, Midlothian and East Lothian; further congratulates mindscape.org.uk on the launch of its website on 18 June 2001, the aim of which is to provide a forum for debate on mental health issues, supply information for service users, their friends and families and to challenge stigma and discrimination, and believes that the Scottish Executive should continue to work towards ensuring that mental health service users have access to appropriate services and levels of support.
S1M-2366# Consultation and Advocacy Promotion Service (lodged on 25 October 2001) Robin Harper*, Tommy Sheridan*
S1M-2366# Consultation and Advocacy Promotion Service (lodged on 25 October 2001) Mr Jamie Stone*
S1M-2366# Consultation and Advocacy Promotion Service (lodged on 25 October 2001) Donald Gorrie*, Elaine Smith*, Marilyn Livingstone*
S1M-2366# Consultation and Advocacy Promotion Service (lodged on 25 October 2001) Maureen Macmillan*
S1M-2366# Consultation and Advocacy Promotion Service (lodged on 25 October 2001) Mrs Mary Mulligan*
S1M-2366# Consultation and Advocacy Promotion Service (lodged on 25 October 2001) Ms Sandra White*
S1M-2366# Consultation and Advocacy Promotion Service (lodged on 25 October 2001) Cathy Peattie*
S1M-2366# Consultation and Advocacy Promotion Service (lodged on 25 October 2001) Brian Fitzpatrick*
S1M-2366# Consultation and Advocacy Promotion Service (lodged on 25 October 2001) Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Mr Murray Tosh*, Elaine Thomson*, Rhoda Grant*
S1M-2366# Consultation and Advocacy Promotion Service (lodged on 25 October 2001) Irene Oldfather*
